intro: Memecylon yangambense, commonly known as the Yangambi memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa, particularly found in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is a small tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and are usually white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value.
